There are also 6 greek terms for differing types of love.
 
There are also 6 greek terms for differing types of love.
    −
Eros-- erotic love; sometimes portrayed as romantic love. More characterized by passion to a singular person and sexual desire.<br>
+
[[Eros (love)|Eros]]-- erotic love; sometimes portrayed as romantic love. More characterized by passion to a singular person and sexual desire.<br>
−
Platonic-- love between friends, or love where sexual desires are not present (sometimes is referred to under philos instead)<br>
+
[[Platonic love|Platonic]]-- love between friends, or love where sexual desires are not present (sometimes is referred to under philos instead)<br>
−
Storge-- a friendly, affectionate type of love. Sometimes has been portrayed as parental or familial love.<br>
+
[[Storge]]-- a friendly, affectionate type of love. Sometimes has been portrayed as parental or familial love.<br>
−
Philos-- a pluralistic type of "love"; also sometimes written as a friendship type of love.<br>
+
[[Philia|Philos]]-- a pluralistic type of "love"; also sometimes written as a friendship type of love.<br>
−
Agape-- selfless, giving love, the love one has for all of humanity or for others simply because of their human nature.<br>
+
[[Agape]]-- selfless, giving love, the love one has for all of humanity or for others simply because of their human nature.<br>
−
Mania-- obsessive love. (a minor type of love)
+
[[Mania (mythology)|Mania]]-- obsessive love. (a minor type of love)
